body.p:
Paducah Ky May 4th 1864
Govr Bramlette
Dr Sir

Mr Saml Miles the bearer of this visits you in distress - about 8 or 9 months ago his son Wm Miles was arrested under a charge of three robberies in one night & held to bail in 1000$ each case when court sat in Ballard County Bill failed to come up & his bonds with his father the bearer ^security^ was forfeited & since a Jugt went on These. Execution is in the sherrifs hands & levied on the old mans land & tobacco also he has & not enough to pay the Judt of $3000 in the aggregate. & is advertized for sale & so the old man & his wife are about to be harmless homeless - the defendant Bill Miles has joined Forests band- The old man as you will see is quite ignorant & I believe when he went security thought his son innocent, however I suppose he did what any parent would do- from the evidence I cannot say any thing in favor of his son I only feel sorry for the father- The old man comes up and wishes to pay my perquisites & get from you all the leniency you can properly show- The old gentleman has always born the name of an honest man an I am Told- I suggest the propriety of letting him off with all that is coming
to the state but $1000 & give him one year on that, it added to my perquisites will be $1900- I suggest further that if in a year he will produce Bill Miles for Trial to let him off with the $1000

P.S. I wrote you recently in regard to some respites you had given in Ballard & Graves countys for 1 year in which you made no savings for costs & my perquisites, so that now the sheriff will not levy for that much or clerks issue executions, I suppose this was an oversight- further the fines respited were replevied & no provision made to hold the security in replevin bond the respite not understanding-
